forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 12. Wind chill values as low as -5. West wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 21. Wind chill values as low as -5. West wind 18 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 46 mph.

weather_report:
As the night wraps Boston in its quiet embrace, the air carries a crispness that nips at the skin. With temperatures dipping to around twelve degrees, the chill is accentuated by a brisk west wind that lends a bite to the evening air, creating a wind chill that feels even colder. The stars may twinkle in the clear skies, but the patter of frost against glass reminds one that winter holds sway. A solitude prevails, inviting the warmth of a cozy indoor retreat—perhaps a good book or a warm drink—capturing that quiet joy of a winter evening.

Moving into tomorrow, the forecast paints a picturesque scene of sunshine bathing the city. The warmth of the sun will shine down upon the streets, yet the chilly breeze will persist, creating a delightful dichotomy of pleasant warmth layered with a reminder of the season. Dressing in layers will be essential; a sturdy coat, perhaps a knitted scarf to guard against the chill, and a good pair of gloves for the walk outside will ensure comfort. This is a day for gentle exploration—perhaps a leisurely stroll through the local parks where the sun-drenched ground contrasts beautifully with the remnants of winter—welcoming a day that beckons for moments of quiet reflection amidst a vibrant urban landscape.
